about_page.title: Tauan Ribeiro: Full Stack JavaScript Developer
about_page.subtitle: Continuous Growth and Concrete Results
about_page.paragraph1: As a Full Stack JavaScript Developer with 5 years of experience, I am passionate about transforming complex ideas into scalable and high-performance web applications. My expertise spans the JavaScript ecosystem, with proficiency in Node.js, Express.js, React.js, and Next.js, and an intrinsic passion for problem-solving and creating efficient and elegant solutions.
about_page.paragraph2: My journey in the world of technology is marked by a successful transition from a decade of experience in Humanities, including a degree in Literature from USP, translation, editing, and teaching. This background has equipped me with a valuable skill set: meticulous attention to detail, essential for code quality and debugging; clear and effective communication, fundamental for team collaboration and understanding requirements; and sharp analytical thinking to unravel complex challenges. This trajectory demonstrates my remarkable capacity for continuous learning, adaptability, and resilience in the face of new horizons.
about_page.paragraph3: What motivates me most in software development is the endless possibilities that arise when starting to code, when creating a logic or a function. I love the freedom to explore diverse approaches and creative solutions for the same problem, always seeking the most optimized path. I am a great enthusiast of the development community and believe this is the strong point of our profession. I highly value how knowledge, solutions, and methods are shared openly and unrestricted, and how this dynamic drives the evolution of the community as a whole – a philosophy I seek to replicate in any work environment.
about_page.paragraph4: My curiosity drives me to explore the frontiers of technology. I am an active user of Artificial Intelligence, which I consider a powerful multiplier of productivity and knowledge, and I seek to deepen my studies in AI and Machine Learning. Furthermore, I follow the Blockchain universe with great interest, recognizing its growing impact and transformative potential.
about_page.paragraph5: Currently based in Valencia, Spain, where I have resided since 2022 and work remotely for a Brazilian company, I am seeking an opportunity that allows me to grow and evolve long-term. I have high expectations for my career and aspire to an environment where I can contribute significantly to the success of the team and the company, while continuing to enhance my skills and expand my impact. I am a focused professional, dedicated to productivity and the relentless pursuit of continuous improvements.

trajectory_page.main_title: My Trajectory: From Linguistic Analysis to Software Architecture
trajectory_page.intro_paragraph: My professional journey is a testament to my passion for learning and my ability to adapt and solve problems. From a solid foundation in the Humanities, where precision and communication were the essence of my work, I transitioned to the dynamic universe of Full Stack software development. Each carefully constructed step has equipped me with a unique set of skills, allowing me to approach technological challenges with a holistic vision, meticulous attention to detail, and a deep understanding of user experience.
trajectory_page.section1_title: The Roots of Precision and Communication
trajectory_page.section1_paragraph: My career began in the field of language, where clarity, coherence, and accuracy were imperative. These experiences were fundamental in shaping how I approach software development today:
trajectory_page.section1_item1: Translations and Text Reviewer (Liberty Traduções and Casa de Ideias): For years, I honed a **meticulous attention to detail and a critical analysis capacity** to identify and correct errors, qualities directly applicable to debugging and code review. The pursuit of contextual fidelity and linguistic fluidity taught me to unravel complexities and ensure the integrity of each component, whether in a text or an application.
trajectory_page.section1_item2: Translator (Transcendemos Consultoria): The responsibility of translating technical texts from Portuguese to Spanish and English required not only **clarity and terminological precision**, but also **in-depth research** to ensure accuracy and cultural appropriateness. This experience translates today into my ability to create clear documentation, communicate effectively in multicultural teams, and rapidly assimilate new technologies.
trajectory_page.section1_item3: Language Teacher (Blackman Idiomas): Teaching allowed me to develop **strong communication skills, patience, and the ability to simplify complex concepts**. These competencies are crucial for collaboration in agile teams, mentoring junior developers, and explaining technical solutions accessibly, fostering knowledge transfer and simplicity in design.
trajectory_page.section2_title: The Transition to the World of Technology
trajectory_page.section2_paragraph: Driven by a growing passion for technology and the pursuit of innovative challenges, I decided to direct my career towards software development. My academic background in Portuguese Literature (USP) gave me an analytical and structural foundation, which I complemented with an intense and self-directed technical learning process:
trajectory_page.section2_item1: Continuous Learning: I dedicated myself to renowned courses and bootcamps, such as **Ignite (Rocketseat)** and **CS50 (EdX.org)**, in addition to deepening my knowledge in **Functional JavaScript Fundamentals**, **JavaScript Algorithms and Data Structures (freeCodeCamp)**, and **Learn JavaScript (Codecademy)**. This immersion provided me with a comprehensive understanding of best practices and the most relevant technologies in the market.
trajectory_page.section3_title: Consolidation as a Full Stack Developer
trajectory_page.section3_paragraph: With a solid technical foundation, enhanced by my previous experiences, I began my journey as a developer, quickly taking on impactful projects and leadership positions:
trajectory_page.section3_item1: Freelance Full Stack Developer (Camisaria Tereza): My first major project as a Full Stack developer was the creation of a **complete and functional e-commerce platform**. Using **React on the front-end and Node.js on the back-end**, I delivered a robust solution that included a dynamic product catalog, a secure authentication system with **Auth0**, and payment processing integration via **PagSeguro**. This project demonstrated my ability to manage the full development lifecycle of an end-to-end application.
trajectory_page.section3_item2_intro: Full-stack JavaScript Developer (Actionsys): Currently, at Actionsys, I am responsible for the **integral design and development of robust and scalable Full-stack web applications** using **React.js, Next.js, and Node.js**. My contributions include:
trajectory_page.section3_item2_subitem1: Business Impact: I decisively contributed to the transformation of an initial-stage project into a production application, which currently serves **4 client companies**, demonstrating a direct impact on the business and product commercialization.
trajectory_page.section3_item2_subitem2: Strategic Expansion: I initiated and led the project's expansion through integration with **SAP**, generating new business opportunities and facilitating client acquisition for the company.
trajectory_page.section3_item2_subitem3: Advancement and Leadership: I was promoted three times in four years, progressing from Junior Developer to **Technical Lead** of the JavaScript department, where I led a team of 3 developers and directed key projects.
trajectory_page.section3_item2_subitem4: Quality and Productivity: I established and applied coding standards that improved team productivity and elevated code base quality, optimizing processes and ensuring technical excellence.
trajectory_page.section3_item2_conclusion: My experience includes the implementation of **secure and efficient RESTful APIs with Express.js**, advanced database management with **TypeORM**, and the creation of interactive and responsive user interfaces with **Redux** and **Styled Components**. I also led performance optimization and collaboration in software architecture, mentoring junior developers, and ensuring code quality.
trajectory_page.section4_paragraph: With a solid foundation in Full Stack development and an unwavering passion for innovation, I now seek to apply my unique experience and skills in agile teams in Spain. My goal is to contribute to the development of solutions that not only function with technical excellence but also delight users and solve real problems, always with a keen eye for continuous improvement and effective collaboration.

api_monitor.title: API Monitor
api_monitor.subtitle: Ensuring API Reliability and Performance
api_monitor.overview_text: The API Monitor is an essential tool for developers and operations teams seeking to ensure the continuous health and performance of their APIs...
api_monitor.feature_1: Continuous Monitoring: Scheduled and automatic checks of API availability and response time.
api_monitor.feature_2: Customizable Alerts: Instant notifications via email or other channels when an API fails or exceeds performance thresholds.
api_monitor.feature_3: Performance History: Detailed graphs and logs for analyzing trends in uptime, latency, and errors over time.
api_monitor.feature_4: Flexible Configuration: Easily add, edit, and remove APIs for monitoring, defining check intervals and success/failure criteria.
api_monitor.feature_5: Real-time Updates: Interactive dashboard that instantly reflects API status, thanks to bidirectional communication.
api_monitor.stack_text: Despite a minimalist interface, the power of the API Monitor lies in its robust backend architecture and the efficiency of its technologies...
api_monitor.architecture_text: The API Monitor adopts a distributed and event-driven architecture, where the frontend and backend communicate via REST and WebSockets (Socket.IO)...
api_monitor.flow_1: The user configures an API for monitoring via the frontend.
api_monitor.flow_2: The backend registers the API in PostgreSQL (via Prisma) and adds a task to the BULL queue.
api_monitor.flow_3: Independent workers consume tasks from the BULL queue, making HTTP requests to external APIs, measuring response time and status.
api_monitor.flow_4: Results are sent back to the backend, which persists them in PostgreSQL and, in case of critical status changes, triggers events via Socket.IO to the frontend.
api_monitor.flow_5: The frontend receives these updates in real-time, keeping the dashboard always synchronized.
api_monitor.flow_6: If there is a failure or degradation, the backend sends alerts via Nodemailer.
api_monitor.infra_deploy_text: The application is containerized with Docker, ensuring portability and consistency across environments. Deployment is carried out on a VM in DigitalOcean, where Nginx acts as a reverse proxy...
api_monitor.architecture_decision_nginx: Nginx: Was strategically implemented as a reverse proxy to optimize static frontend delivery, load balance to the Node.js backend, and manage SSL termination. Its robustness and efficiency freed the backend to focus exclusively on business logic, while providing an essential layer of security and performance for the application.
api_monitor.architecture_decision_socketio: Socket.IO: The choice of Socket.IO was fundamental to the API Monitor's value proposition, enabling real-time bidirectional communication. This allowed the dashboard to display API status instantly, eliminating the need for polling and ensuring a fluid and reactive user experience, with lower latency and optimized server resource usage.
api_monitor.challenges_text: The development of the API Monitor was an intensive learning journey, especially in building a robust and scalable architecture for monitoring.
api_monitor.challenge_infra_devops_text: One of the biggest challenges and learnings was the complete infrastructure setup. From creating and managing a Virtual Machine (VM) on DigitalOcean, through containerizing the application with Docker, which ensured an isolated and consistent environment for all dependencies, to configuring Nginx as a reverse proxy. This process required deep dives into networking concepts, container orchestration, and server optimization, resulting in a robust and efficient deployment that not only simplified the process but also elevated the solution's robustness and scalability.
api_monitor.challenge_realtime_comm_text: Implementing Socket.IO for real-time bidirectional communication was another major learning point. Mastering server and client configuration, and ensuring that API status updates were delivered instantly and reliably to the dashboard, was fundamental to the application's value proposition.
api_monitor.challenge_queue_mgmt_title: Queue Management with BULL and Redis:
api_monitor.challenge_queue_mgmt_text: To handle asynchronous scheduling and processing of API checks, integrating BULL (with Redis as backend) was crucial. This allowed for the creation of a resilient queue system, capable of processing a large volume of monitoring tasks without blocking the main server, ensuring that checks occur reliably and scalably.
api_monitor.challenge_reliable_scheduling_text: Ensuring that API checks occur at exact intervals, even under load, required careful implementation of schedulers and workers, with retry mechanisms and failure handling. Configuring success criteria (HTTP status, response content) and implementing multiple attempts before declaring an API 'down' were crucial to avoid unnecessary alerts and ensure the accuracy of the reported status.
api_monitor.challenge_historical_data_text: Developing an efficient way to store and query large volumes of monitoring data to generate performance trend graphs was a significant learning in database optimization and data processing.
